title: Clicking on field after run crashes niki
description:
After running a program, clicking on the field causes niki to crash.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Load a program (e.g., laby.pas)
2. Run the program (Ctrl-F9)
3. Wait for it to complete or stop it
4. Click on the field
5. Crash occurs

When clicking on "Ausführen" (Run):

The interpreter appears to be broken. Program compiles but doesn't execute.

title: Investigate official Unicode Free Vision (units starting with 'u')
description:
The utf8 TV fork we use mentions on their GitHub page:

> Free Vision has already been ported to Unicode in Free Pascal. So it's probably better to use official implementation (see units with names starting with "u").

Tasks:
1. Find and investigate the official Unicode Free Vision units in Free Pascal
2. Compare capabilities with our current fv_utf8/ fork
3. Determine if we can switch to the official implementation
4. Document what should happen with our patches against the utf8 version:
   - views.pas: 64-bit TDrawBuffer for UTF-8, drag'n'drop screen updates
   - drivers.pas: Mouse event routing fix (keycode 0 -> evNothing)
   - keyboard.pp: SGR 1006 extended mouse protocol parsing
   - mouse.pp: Mouse mode 1002 (button-event tracking) for drag support

title: Port help system to 64-bit Free Pascal
description: The help system (helpfile.pas) crashes when trying to open help. It uses old Turbo Vision 16-bit data structures and stream format that need updating for 64-bit Free Pascal. Key issues: VmtLink registration, stream object loading, WrapText bounds checking.

Ausführen from field window should run last executed program
description:
When the field window is focused, pressing Ctrl-F9 (Ausführen/Run) does nothing.

**Expected behavior:**
1. Remember which editor window was last used for execution
2. When Ausführen is triggered from the field window, run that remembered program
3. When an editor is selected/focused, remember it as the program to execute for future runs

This allows quick re-running of a program while watching the robot in the field.

comments.author: Dr. Stefan Schimanski
comments.text: Additional requirement: When there is only one editor open, use that one for execution and remember it as the active one for future runs.
